description: Low level geometric primitives which can greatly simplify writing scripts which involve geometry manipulation. The Point2D and Point3D primitives are widely used to set the end points of spans and while building geometry. The Box2D and Box3D objects are extremely useful for determining the size and position of objects.

classes.name: ContourCarriage
classes.documentation: ContourCarriage is used to move along a contour a fixed distance at a time irrespective of the number of spans in the contour or the type of spans. It maintains a position on a contour and can move forward or backward along it.

constructors.label: ContourCarriage(ctr: Contour, pt: Point2D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a 'carriage' for the passed contour and positions it at the nearest point on the contour to the passed point

parameters.label: ctr
parameters.documentation: ctr: Contour - the contour that the carriage travels along

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: pt: Point2D - the carriage is positioned at the closest point to this

constructors.label: ContourCarriage(span_index: number, parameter: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates a 'carriage' for a contour and sets its position for the span with the passed index at the passed parameter position (in range 0-1.0). Usually specified as (0, 0.0) to position at start of first span.

parameters.label: span_index
parameters.documentation: span_index: number - index of span carriage will be positioned at

properties.name: IsInvalid
properties.documentation: Returns true if current position is invalid

properties.name: SpanIndex
properties.documentation: Returns span index for current position of carriage

properties.name: SpanParameter
properties.documentation: Returns span parameter (in range 0-1.0) for current position of carriage

methods.name: Move
methods.documentation: Moves the carriage the requested distance along the contour. Returns true if managed to move requested distance successfully. If the contour is closed we will wrap around at the end. Negative values move backward.

signature.label: Move(ctr: Contour, distance: number)
signature.documentation: Move carriage along contour

parameters.label: ctr
parameters.documentation: ctr: Contour - the contour this carriage rides along

parameters.label: distance
parameters.documentation: distance: number - distance to move (negative = backward)

methods.name: Position
methods.documentation: Returns a Point2D representing the current position of the carriage on the passed contour

signature.label: Position(ctr: Contour)
signature.documentation: Get current position on contour

parameters.label: ctr
parameters.documentation: ctr: Contour - the contour this carriage rides along

methods.name: UpdatePosition
methods.documentation: Update the position of the carriage to the nearest position on the contour to the passed point

signature.label: UpdatePosition(ctr: Contour, pt: Point2D)
signature.documentation: Update carriage to nearest point

parameters.label: ctr
parameters.documentation: ctr: Contour - the contour that the carriage travels along

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: pt: Point2D - position to snap to

classes.name: Span
classes.documentation: Span is the base class for spans in a Contour. Spans are either lines, arcs, beziers, or a single 'point'. Most spans are created as LineSpan, ArcSpan, or BezierSpan. Use type properties to determine span type.

constructors.label: Span(pt3d: Point3D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new span representing a single point

parameters.label: pt3d
parameters.documentation: pt3d: Point3D - 3D position for a point

properties.name: EndPoint3D
properties.documentation: The 3D end point of the span

properties.name: EndPoint2D
properties.documentation: The 2D end point of the span

properties.name: StartPoint3D
properties.documentation: The 3D start point of the span

properties.name: StartPoint2D
properties.documentation: The 2D start point of the span

properties.name: IsLineType
properties.documentation: Returns true if span is a line

properties.name: IsArcType
properties.documentation: Returns true if span is an arc

properties.name: IsBezierType
properties.documentation: Returns true if span is a bezier

properties.name: IsLeadInType
properties.documentation: Returns true if span is a lead in

properties.name: IsLeadOutType
properties.documentation: Returns true if span is a lead out

properties.name: IsOvercutType
properties.documentation: Returns true if span is part of an overcut

properties.name: NumberOfControlPoints
properties.documentation: Number of control points for span (2 for Bezier, 1 for arc (mid point), 0 for line)

properties.name: Type
properties.documentation: Enum identifying type of the span. Usual values are Span.NormalLine, Span.Arc, and Span.Bezier

methods.name: ChordLength
methods.documentation: Return the straight line distance between start and end points of the span

signature.label: ChordLength()
signature.documentation: Get chord length

methods.name: EndVector
methods.documentation: Return a Vector2D representing the direction of the span at the end

signature.label: EndVector(normalise: boolean)
signature.documentation: Get direction at end

parameters.label: normalise
parameters.documentation: normalise: boolean - if true, returned vector is normalized

methods.name: StartVector
methods.documentation: Return a Vector2D representing the direction of the span at the start

signature.label: StartVector(normalise: boolean)
signature.documentation: Get direction at start

parameters.label: normalise
parameters.documentation: normalise: boolean - if true, returned vector is normalized

methods.name: GetControlPointPosition
methods.documentation: Return a Point2D with position of requested control point. Only valid on Bezier or Arc. For Bezier: 0=first control point, 1=second. For Arc: 0=mid point.

signature.label: GetControlPointPosition(index: number)
signature.documentation: Get control point position

parameters.label: index
parameters.documentation: index: number - index of control point

methods.name: GetLength
methods.documentation: Return the length of the span. The tolerance is used for beziers to approximate length.

signature.label: GetLength(tolerance: number)
signature.documentation: Get span length

parameters.label: tolerance
parameters.documentation: tolerance: number - tolerance for polygonizing beziers

methods.name: MoveControlPoint
methods.documentation: Only valid for arc or Bezier. Attempts to move the specified control point to the passed position. Returns false if control point can't be moved (e.g., would make invalid arc).

signature.label: MoveControlPoint(index: number, pt: Point2D)
signature.documentation: Move control point

parameters.label: index
parameters.documentation: index: number - index of control point

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: pt: Point2D - new position for control point

methods.name: PointAtParameter
methods.documentation: Return a Point2D representing the point on the span at passed parameter in range 0-1.0

signature.label: PointAtParameter(param: number, tolerance: number)
signature.documentation: Get point at parameter

parameters.label: tolerance
parameters.documentation: tolerance: number - tolerance for polygonizing beziers

methods.name: Reverse
methods.documentation: Reverse the span - swap start and end points. For arcs: swap sign of bulge. For beziers: swap control points.

signature.label: Reverse()
signature.documentation: Reverse span direction

methods.name: SetStartPoint3D
methods.documentation: Set start point for span. WARNING: Be EXTREMELY careful - calling this on spans in a contour can open gaps between adjoining spans.

signature.label: SetStartPoint3D(pt: Point3D)
signature.documentation: Set start point (use with caution)

methods.name: SetStartPoint2D
methods.documentation: Set start point for span. WARNING: Be EXTREMELY careful - calling this on spans in a contour can open gaps between adjoining spans.

signature.label: SetStartPoint2D(pt: Point2D)
signature.documentation: Set start point (use with caution)

methods.name: SetEndPoint3D
methods.documentation: Set end point for span. WARNING: Be EXTREMELY careful - calling this on spans in a contour can open gaps between adjoining spans.

signature.label: SetEndPoint3D(pt: Point3D)
signature.documentation: Set end point (use with caution)

methods.name: SetEndPoint2D
methods.documentation: Set end point for span. WARNING: Be EXTREMELY careful - calling this on spans in a contour can open gaps between adjoining spans.

signature.label: SetEndPoint2D(pt: Point2D)
signature.documentation: Set end point (use with caution)

classes.name: LineSpan
classes.documentation: LineSpan represents a line span in a Contour. It is derived from the Span class and all methods and properties of the Span class are valid on this object. You can use the LineTo methods on Contour to avoid span creation.

constructors.label: LineSpan(start_pt: Point3D, end_pt: Point3D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new line span with 3D points

constructors.label: LineSpan(start_pt: Point2D, end_pt: Point2D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new line span with 2D points

methods.name: ClosestParameterToPoint
methods.documentation: Return the parameter of the point on the line which is closest to the passed point

signature.label: ClosestParameterToPoint(pt: Point2D)
signature.documentation: Find closest parameter to point

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: pt: Point2D - point to find closest parameter to

classes.name: ArcSpan
classes.documentation: ArcSpan represents an arc span in a Contour. It is derived from the Span class and all methods and properties of the Span class are valid. Arcs are represented internally using start/end points and a 'bulge factor' which controls the arc shape (bulge = (2*arc_height) / chord_length). Maximum arc angle is 180 degrees.

constructors.label: ArcSpan(start_pt: Point2D, end_pt: Point2D, pt_on_arc: Point2D)
constructors.documentation: Creates arc through three 2D points (max 180 degrees)

constructors.label: ArcSpan(start_pt: Point2D, end_pt: Point2D, centre_pt: Point2D, ccw: boolean)
constructors.documentation: Creates arc with 2D points and center (max 180 degrees)

constructors.label: ArcSpan(start_pt: Point3D, end_pt: Point3D, centre_pt: Point3D, ccw: boolean)
constructors.documentation: Creates arc with 3D points and center (max 180 degrees)

parameters.label: end_pt
parameters.documentation: end_pt: Point3D - end point (same Z as start)

constructors.label: ArcSpan(start_pt: Point2D, end_pt: Point2D, bulge: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates arc with 2D points and bulge factor (max 180 degrees)

parameters.label: bulge
parameters.documentation: bulge: number - bulge factor for arc

constructors.label: ArcSpan(start_pt: Point3D, end_pt: Point3D, bulge: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates arc with 3D points and bulge factor (max 180 degrees)

parameters.label: end_pt
parameters.documentation: end_pt: Point3D - end point (same Z as start)

parameters.label: bulge
parameters.documentation: bulge: number - bulge factor for arc

properties.name: Bulge
properties.documentation: Signed bulge for arc

properties.name: IsAntiClockwise
properties.documentation: Returns true if arc is anti-clockwise (same as IsCCW)

properties.name: IsCCW
properties.documentation: Returns true if arc is counter-clockwise (same as IsAntiClockwise)

properties.name: IsClockwise
properties.documentation: Returns true if arc is clockwise (same as IsCW)

properties.name: IsCW
properties.documentation: Returns true if arc is clockwise (same as IsClockwise)

methods.name: ArcMidPoint
methods.documentation: Returns a Point3D holding the mid point of the arc

signature.label: ArcMidPoint()
signature.documentation: Get arc mid point

methods.name: RadiusAndCentre
methods.documentation: Calculate the center point of the arc and the radius. Returns the radius and sets the passed point to the center position.

signature.label: RadiusAndCentre(ret_centre_pt: Point3D)
signature.documentation: Get radius and center

parameters.label: ret_centre_pt
parameters.documentation: ret_centre_pt: Point3D - returned center point position

methods.name: SetBulge
methods.documentation: Set the bulge factor for this arc

signature.label: SetBulge(bulge: number)
signature.documentation: Set arc bulge

parameters.label: bulge
parameters.documentation: bulge: number - bulge factor for arc

classes.name: BezierSpan
classes.documentation: BezierSpan represents a bezier span in a Contour. It is derived from the Span class and all methods and properties of the Span class are valid on this object. You can use the BezierTo methods on Contour to avoid span creation.

constructors.label: BezierSpan(start_pt: Point2D, end_pt: Point2D, ctrl_pt_1: Point2D, ctrl_pt_2: Point2D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a bezier span with 2D points

constructors.label: BezierSpan(start_pt: Point3D, end_pt: Point3D, ctrl_pt_1: Point2D, ctrl_pt_2: Point2D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a bezier span with 3D start/end and 2D control points

parameters.label: end_pt
parameters.documentation: end_pt: Point3D - 3D end point (same Z as start)

classes.name: Point2D
classes.documentation: Represents a 2D point (X and Y values only). Used by many other objects and can be used with geometry objects such as Vector2D to perform calculations.

constructors.label: Point2D()
constructors.documentation: Constructs an un-initialised point with invalid x and y values.

constructors.label: Point2D(x: number, y: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new point with the specified X and Y values.

parameters.label: x
parameters.documentation: The value for the x coordinate of the point

parameters.label: y
parameters.documentation: The value for the y coordinate of the point

constructors.label: Point2D(pt: Point2D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new point with the same X and Y values as the passed point.

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: An existing point to copy X and Y values from

properties.name: X
properties.documentation: X coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: x
properties.documentation: X coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: Y
properties.documentation: Y coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: y
properties.documentation: Y coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: IsInvalid
properties.documentation: Returns true if the point is invalid - not initialised or SetInvalid called

methods.name: Clone
methods.documentation: Returns a new Point2D which is an exact copy of this one

signature.label: Clone()
signature.documentation: Returns a new Point2D which is an exact copy of this one

methods.name: Equals
methods.documentation: Returns true if this point equals the passed point within the passed tolerance. Tolerance can be 0.0

signature.label: Equals(pt: Point2D, tolerance: number)
signature.documentation: Returns true if this point equals the passed point within the passed tolerance

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: pt: Point2D - point to compare with

parameters.label: tolerance
parameters.documentation: tolerance: number - tolerance for comparison (can be 0.0)

methods.name: Length
methods.documentation: Returns the length of the vector from the origin (0,0) to this point

signature.label: Length()
signature.documentation: Returns the length of the vector from the origin (0,0) to this point

methods.name: Offset
methods.documentation: Offset this point by the passed x and y values

signature.label: Offset(x: number, y: number)
signature.documentation: Offset this point by the passed x and y values

methods.name: SetInvalid
methods.documentation: Set the point to an invalid state

signature.label: SetInvalid()
signature.documentation: Set the point to an invalid state

classes.name: Point3D
classes.documentation: Represents a 3D point (X, Y and Z values). Used by many other objects and can be used with geometry objects such as Vector3D to perform calculations.

constructors.label: Point3D()
constructors.documentation: Constructs an un-initialised point with invalid x, y and z values.

constructors.label: Point3D(x: number, y: number, z: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new point with the specified X, Y and Z values.

parameters.label: x
parameters.documentation: The value for the x coordinate

parameters.label: y
parameters.documentation: The value for the y coordinate

parameters.label: z
parameters.documentation: The value for the z coordinate

constructors.label: Point3D(pt: Point3D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new point with the same X, Y and Z values as the passed point.

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: An existing point to copy values from

constructors.label: Point3D(pt: Point2D, z: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new 3D point using the X and Y values from the passed 2D point and the specified Z value.

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: Point2D to get X and Y from

properties.name: X
properties.documentation: X coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: x
properties.documentation: X coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: Y
properties.documentation: Y coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: y
properties.documentation: Y coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: Z
properties.documentation: Z coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: z
properties.documentation: Z coordinate for point (read/write)

properties.name: IsInvalid
properties.documentation: Returns true if the point is invalid - not initialised or SetInvalid called

methods.name: Clone
methods.documentation: Returns a new Point3D which is an exact copy of this one

signature.label: Clone()
signature.documentation: Returns a new Point3D which is an exact copy of this one

methods.name: Equals
methods.documentation: Returns true if this point equals the passed point within the passed tolerance

signature.label: Equals(pt: Point3D, tolerance: number)
signature.documentation: Returns true if this point equals the passed point within the passed tolerance

parameters.label: pt
parameters.documentation: pt: Point3D - point to compare with

parameters.label: tolerance
parameters.documentation: tolerance: number - tolerance for comparison (can be 0.0)

methods.name: Length
methods.documentation: Returns the length of the vector from the origin (0,0,0) to this point

signature.label: Length()
signature.documentation: Returns the length of the vector from the origin (0,0,0) to this point

methods.name: Offset
methods.detail: (x: number, y: number, z: number) → void
methods.documentation: Offset this point by the passed x, y and z values

signature.label: Offset(x: number, y: number, z: number)
signature.documentation: Offset this point by the passed x, y and z values

methods.name: SetInvalid
methods.documentation: Set the point to an invalid state

signature.label: SetInvalid()
signature.documentation: Set the point to an invalid state

classes.name: Vector2D
classes.documentation: Represents a 2D vector (X and Y components). Used for geometric calculations and transformations.

constructors.label: Vector2D()
constructors.documentation: Creates a zero vector (0, 0).

constructors.label: Vector2D(x: number, y: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new vector with the specified X and Y components.

parameters.label: x
parameters.documentation: The value for the x component

parameters.label: y
parameters.documentation: The value for the y component

constructors.label: Vector2D(vec: Vector2D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a new vector with the same X and Y values as the passed vector.

parameters.label: vec
parameters.documentation: An existing vector to copy values from

properties.name: X
properties.documentation: X component of vector (read/write)

properties.name: x
properties.documentation: X component of vector (read/write)

properties.name: Y
properties.documentation: Y component of vector (read/write)

properties.name: y
properties.documentation: Y component of vector (read/write)

methods.name: Angle
methods.documentation: Returns the angle of the vector in radians (from positive X axis)

signature.label: Angle()
signature.documentation: Returns the angle of the vector in radians

methods.name: Clone
methods.documentation: Returns a new Vector2D which is an exact copy of this one

signature.label: Clone()
signature.documentation: Returns a new Vector2D which is an exact copy of this one

methods.name: Length
methods.documentation: Returns the length (magnitude) of the vector

signature.label: Length()
signature.documentation: Returns the length (magnitude) of the vector

methods.name: Normalize
methods.documentation: Normalize this vector to unit length

signature.label: Normalize()
signature.documentation: Normalize this vector to unit length

methods.name: Perpendicular
methods.documentation: Returns a perpendicular vector to this one

signature.label: Perpendicular(clockwise: boolean)
signature.documentation: Returns a perpendicular vector to this one

parameters.label: clockwise
parameters.documentation: clockwise: boolean - if true return clockwise perpendicular, else anti-clockwise

methods.name: Rotate
methods.documentation: Rotate this vector by the specified angle in radians

signature.label: Rotate(angle: number)
signature.documentation: Rotate this vector by the specified angle in radians

classes.name: Box2D
classes.documentation: Represents a 2D bounding box defined by minimum and maximum X and Y coordinates. Extremely useful for determining the size and position of objects.

constructors.label: Box2D()
constructors.documentation: Creates an empty (invalid) bounding box.

constructors.label: Box2D(min_x: number, min_y: number, max_x: number, max_y: number)
constructors.documentation: Creates a bounding box with the specified minimum and maximum coordinates.

constructors.label: Box2D(pt1: Point2D, pt2: Point2D)
constructors.documentation: Creates a bounding box from two corner points.

properties.name: IsEmpty
properties.documentation: Returns true if the box is empty (invalid)

properties.name: BLC
properties.documentation: Bottom left corner of box (read only)

properties.name: BRC
properties.documentation: Bottom right corner of box (read only)

properties.name: TLC
properties.documentation: Top left corner of box (read only)

properties.name: TRC
properties.documentation: Top right corner of box (read only)

properties.name: Centre
properties.documentation: Centre point of box (read only)

properties.name: XLength
properties.documentation: Length of box in X direction (read only)

properties.name: YLength
properties.documentation: Length of box in Y direction (read only)

methods.name: Clone
methods.documentation: Returns a new Box2D which is an exact copy of this one

signature.label: Clone()
signature.documentation: Returns a new Box2D which is an exact copy of this one

methods.name: Expand
methods.documentation: Expand the box by the specified amount in all directions

signature.label: Expand(amount: number)
signature.documentation: Expand the box by the specified amount in all directions

parameters.label: amount
parameters.documentation: amount: number - amount to expand by

methods.name: IncludeBox
methods.documentation: Expand this box to include the passed box

signature.label: IncludeBox(box: Box2D)
signature.documentation: Expand this box to include the passed box

methods.name: IncludePoint
methods.documentation: Expand this box to include the passed point

signature.label: IncludePoint(pt: Point2D)
signature.documentation: Expand this box to include the passed point

methods.name: IsPointInside
methods.documentation: Returns true if the passed point is inside the box

signature.label: IsPointInside(pt: Point2D)
signature.documentation: Returns true if the passed point is inside the box

methods.name: Overlaps
methods.documentation: Returns true if this box overlaps the passed box

signature.label: Overlaps(box: Box2D)
signature.documentation: Returns true if this box overlaps the passed box

parameters.label: box
parameters.documentation: box: Box2D - box to test overlap with

classes.name: Box3D
classes.documentation: Represents a 3D bounding box defined by minimum and maximum X, Y and Z coordinates. Extremely useful for determining the size and position of 3D objects.

properties.name: BLC
properties.documentation: Bottom left corner of bounding box

properties.name: BRC
properties.documentation: Bottom right corner of bounding box

properties.name: Centre
properties.documentation: Centre point of bounding box

properties.name: MaxLength
properties.documentation: The length of the longest side for the bounding box

properties.name: MaxX
properties.documentation: The maximum X value for the bounding box

properties.name: MaxY
properties.documentation: The maximum Y value for the bounding box

properties.name: MaxZ
properties.documentation: The maximum Z value for the bounding box

properties.name: MinLength
properties.documentation: The length of the shortest side for the bounding box

properties.name: MinX
properties.documentation: The minimum X value for the bounding box

properties.name: MinY
properties.documentation: The minimum Y value for the bounding box

properties.name: MinZ
properties.documentation: The minimum Z value for the bounding box

properties.name: TLC
properties.documentation: Top left corner of bounding box

properties.name: TRC
properties.documentation: Top right corner of bounding box

properties.name: XLength
properties.documentation: The length in X for the bounding box

properties.name: YLength
properties.documentation: The length in Y for the bounding box

properties.name: ZLength
properties.documentation: The length in Z for the bounding box

methods.name: Expand
methods.documentation: Expand this box on all sides by passed amount

signature.label: Expand(offset_dist: number)
signature.documentation: Expand box on all sides

parameters.label: offset_dist
parameters.documentation: offset_dist: number - distance to offset box by

methods.name: IsInside
methods.documentation: Return true if passed point is inside this box within passed tolerance (which may be 0.0)

signature.label: IsInside(point: Point3D, tol: number)
signature.documentation: Check if point is inside box

methods.name: IsInsideOrOn
methods.documentation: Return true if passed point is inside or on the edge of this box within passed tolerance

signature.label: IsInsideOrOn(point: Point3D, tol: number)
signature.documentation: Check if point is inside or on box edge

methods.name: Intersects
methods.documentation: Return true if passed box intersects this box within passed tolerance

signature.label: Intersects(box: Box3D, tol: number)
signature.documentation: Check if boxes intersect

methods.name: Merge
methods.detail: (x: number, y: number, z: number) → void
methods.documentation: Merge a point with the passed values into the box updating limits

signature.label: Merge(x: number, y: number, z: number)
signature.documentation: Merge point into box

parameters.label: x
parameters.documentation: x: number - x value for point

parameters.label: y
parameters.documentation: y: number - y value for point

parameters.label: z
parameters.documentation: z: number - z value for point

methods.name: SetInvalid
methods.documentation: Set the box to invalid state

signature.label: SetInvalid()
signature.documentation: Set box to invalid state
